snippet.title: Inside the New POTA Board’s Vision: Mark K8MST
snippet.description:
Mark Torigian K8MST is a retired attorney, former general counsel for Hyundai Motor Company, and now a driving force behind establishing strong governance principles with the newly formed Parks on the Air board.

Licensed in 2021 after decades of putting off the hobby, Mark dove headfirst into ham radio—and POTA—during the pandemic, first as a hunter, then as an activator with hundreds of parks under his belt. In just a few years, he went from newcomer to board member of one of the fastest-growing programs in amateur radio. With nearly 50 million QSOs logged, 84,000 registered operators, and 85,000 parks across 236 DX entities, POTA isn’t just thriving—it’s reshaping the hobby.

Mark brings something different to the table: four decades of legal and corporate governance experience. At Hyundai, his mission was program integrity—building rules, systems, and internal controls that could withstand explosive growth. Now he’s applying that same mindset to POTA. Not to burden activators and hunters with red tape, but to strengthen the foundation behind the scenes: bylaws, board structure, financial oversight, data privacy protections, and clearer rules that eliminate ambiguity. “If ten hams interpret a rule and you get twenty-five answers,” he says, “we need to fix that.”

Behind the curtain, a 21-person volunteer development team led by James Linden, VE3JLN, is rewriting the IT backbone—modernizing a decade-old cloud-based system that now processes more than a million QSOs a month. Add to that the financial reality: roughly $5,000–$6,000 per month just to keep the servers running. No corporate sponsor bankrolls this operation. It’s volunteers, modest book royalties, and community donations keeping the engine alive.

And yet, the spirit remains intact. Mark tells the story of operating Winter Field Day at minus 15 degrees—three antennas up in an hour—proving that POTA is more than a game. It’s training. It’s readiness. It’s community. His pledge? Make it better without breaking what already works. Stronger governance. Greater transparency. Seamless improvement.

Join the conversation and subscribe to Q5 Worldwide Ham Radio.

A special thank you to DX Engineering for standing behind operators everywhere—from Parks on the Air activators to dedicated DXers and contesters—with equipment and expertise that keep stations on the air. Your support helps ensure this global community continues to grow and thrive.

snippet.title: SOTA Adventure: Is this the Hardest 2 Point Summit in SoCal?
snippet.description:
On this Mountain CW Ops adventure, I drove to the Sawtooth Mountain Wilderness to hike and activate Storm Canyon Mountain, no trail, steep terrain and lots of scrambling up this rarely activated  2 point SOTA peak. So far this has been the hardest 2 point summit activation and come along for this incredible ascent and descent up Storm Canyon Mountain. 


🔥 Support My Adventures! 🔥

snippet.title: Episode 4 — Technician Privileges: What You Actually Get to Do
snippet.description:
A lot of people treat the Technician license like it’s a learner’s permit.

It isn’t.

In this episode, I walk through what a Technician class license actually allows you to do — and why most operators never fully use what they already have.

We’re talking about:

What VHF and UHF are actually good for

Why repeaters are powerful but not magic

Why simplex matters more than most people think #Packet 

The difference between infrastructure and independence

And why the Technician license is often underutilized, not underpowered

Local communication wins first. Always.

You can build a strong, resilient local and regional communications structure with a Technician license if you understand what you’re doing. Most people simply never explore the edges of what they already have access to.

This episode isn’t a band chart lecture.
It isn’t frequency memorization.
It’s a reset on expectations.

The license doesn’t limit you nearly as much as your effort does.

As Mentioned:

Jason-KM4ACK https://www.youtube.com/@UCSQhXfGo_68Ta8-2wStAWkw 
The Tech Prepper https://www.youtube.com/@UCacth3foPsjqgV4wW4kuDDw 
The Comms Channel https://www.youtube.com/@UCjEDZ_R_ypSc-MUBRkiW1lw 
Mad Gear Co https://www.youtube.com/@UCPAwSZY1TlRfUVmAAPEr62w 

Addendum: Why I Talked So Much About #Packet

I spent a lot of time talking about packet radio in this episode because I believe it’s one of the most practical tools available to the prepper who wants a messaging option that doesn’t depend on outside infrastructure.

It’s simple in concept: radio-to-radio data (SIMPLEX), no cell towers, no internet, no third-party platform in the middle.

And the part most people miss is this — you don’t need an advanced license to start exploring it. A Technician class license is enough to begin working with VHF packet and building real capability.

That’s why it matters.


New Book: Before You Buy Anything

If you’re trying to approach communications without panic or impulse purchases, my new book Before You Buy Anything walks through how to think clearly before you start stacking gear. It’s short, direct, and built for heads of household who want order, not theatrics.

Available here:
https://amzn.to/3MNGDf4

Ready to Go Further?

If this episode clarified things for you and you’re ready to stop guessing, here are the two ways I help:

1. The 30/30 Ham Radio Challenge
A simple, daily plan to earn your license and actually start using ham radio.
No cramming. No drama. Just steady progress.
https://www.familyconnectsystem.com/3030welcome

2. The 90-Minute Communications Planning Session
If you want to talk through your situation—distance, family, expectations, and realistic options—this is where we do that.
No gear sales. No theory. Just clarity.
https://www.familyconnectsystem.com/first-five-minutes

If neither of those are for you, that’s fine too.
This show exists to explain the landscape, not convince anyone to walk it.

snippet.title: I Bought My First HF Radio… 🎉 | Unboxing
snippet.description:
Buying your first HF radio is a pretty big moment.

In this video, I’m unboxing my first HF transceiver and just sharing my honest first impressions as I see it for the first time — what stands out to me, how it feels, and why I finally decided to take this step.

I’ll talk through what made me pull the trigger, what I’m hoping to learn as I start spending more time on the HF bands, and what this next chapter might look like.

If you’re thinking about getting your first HF radio too, or you remember what that moment felt like for you, this one’s for you.

📡 Callsign: KJ5LXP
📍 Location: Texas

📌 Helpful Links & Resources

snippet.title: POTA making us forget how to talk??
snippet.description:
Is POTA making us forget how to talk? 📻

I love a good activation as much as anyone, but today I’m ditching the hunt for a reference number to focus on what ham radio was built for: the ragchew. I’m setting up portable at a non-POTA park to slow things down, enjoy some CW, and have a real conversation on HF.

Let's branch out from the 59 exchange and remember the 'art' of the chat!

All my gear here: 
https://linktr.ee/HobbySteve

Autonomous Sensory Meridian Response is an experience characterized by a static-like tingling sensation. 
on the skin that typically begins on the scalp and moves down the back of neck and upper spine.

snippet.title: DIY Ham Radio Setup With 3D Printed Parts #maker #diy
snippet.description: In this DIY ham radio setup tutorial, we will be showcasing a unique and innovative way to create a functional ham radio using 3D printed parts. As a maker and enthusiast of 3D printing, you will learn how to utilize your 3D printer to create useful and functional components for your ham radio setup. We will be using a Bambu Lab A1 mini 3D printer to create the necessary parts, and pairing it with a Baofeng UV-5R mini radio for a compact and efficient setup. This project is perfect for amateur radio operators, preppers, and individuals interested in emergency preparedness, as it provides a reliable means of communication in case of an emergency. With the help of 3D printing, you can create custom components such as radio mounts, antenna holders, and other useful accessories to enhance your ham radio experience. Whether you are a beginner in 3D printing or an experienced maker, this project is a great way to explore the possibilities of 3D printing for beginners and experienced users alike. By following this tutorial, you will be able to create your own DIY ham radio setup with 3D printed parts, and enjoy the benefits of amateur radio communication with a unique and customized setup.

snippet.title: Parks on the Air explained to total strangers! Never miss a chance to share the hobby.
snippet.description:
During a recent park activation, I was approached by two random hikers.  They were in search of the largest Bald Cypress tree in the United States.  It's located with US-0305.  That encountered led to their curiosity about exactly what I was doing.  I wasn't about to miss an opportunity to share our hobby with others, so I took a little time to try and explain the Parks on the Air program.  They were truly fascinated and one walked away saying "I'll have to look into it. That's cool".  And, yes it is.
#pota 
#parksontheair 
#hamradio 
#hamradioantenna 
#portableradio 

Thanks for watching.   Please like and share if you found this interesting.  If you enjoy the channel, please subscribe.
73
Paul
KJ5GKK

snippet.title: Fun way to build antennas! 😎
snippet.description:
Stop Fighting the Trees! 🌲🚀
Discount code: HOBBYSTEVE
Products: https://linktr.ee/HobbySteve

In today’s video, I’m showing off the One Shot Antenna Slingshot—a total game-changer for my POTA (Parks on the Air) setup. I’ve recently started building my own antennas, and let’s be honest: getting that wire into the canopy is usually the hardest part of the activation.

I’ve paired the One Shot with an LDG 9:1 Unun for a lightweight, high-performance random wire setup that makes deployment a breeze. If you’re tired of tangled lines and failed tosses, this is the tool you need in your go-kit.

What we cover today:

Unboxing 

How to launch a line perfectly on the first try.

Pairing the launcher with the LDG 9:1 for a fast POTA setup.

snippet.title: 2m 70cm AND 1.25m On A Budget Radio? #shorts #hamradio
snippet.description: If you're a beginner ham or looking to upgrade your amateur radio setup on a budget, this video is for you. We're exploring the possibility of using a 2m 70cm and 1.25m radio without breaking the bank. As a new ham, finding the right entry radio can be daunting, but with the right ham gear, you can set up a reliable ham shack. In this video, we'll be unboxing and testing a quick radio solution that's perfect for ham beginners. Whether you're interested in VHF UHF frequencies or just starting out with RF basics, this radio deal is worth considering. With its compact design and user-friendly interface, it's an ideal starter radio for anyone looking to get into the ham radio hobby. We'll be discussing the radio's features, setup, and performance, as well as providing tips for those new to amateur radio. If you're looking for a radio that's easy to use and won't blow your budget, keep watching to see if this radio is the right fit for you. As we delve into the world of ham radio, we'll cover topics such as radio tech, ham setup, and more, so be sure to subscribe for future content on ham gear, radio hobby, and RF life.

snippet.title: New GMRS Frequencies Coming? Here's What You Need to Know
snippet.description:
🚨 GMRS Update 2026: Latest on the FCC petition to add low-band VHF frequencies (30-50 MHz) to GMRS users! Discover the modified proposal, recent FCC rule changes sparking new momentum, potential for massive range improvements, and what this means for GMRS & FRS enthusiasts. Could we soon get long-range low-band channels for better rural/off-grid comms?

In this video, we break down the renewed push for VHF low-band expansion, including details from National Communications Magazine and community reactions. Don't miss the potential game-changer for General Mobile Radio Service!

Today's video is sponsored by Ham Radio Prep - save 20% off of all courses with code JASON20 here https://geni.us/830iXi5

snippet.title: Trump's Surgeon General Nom Under Fire! No Medical License? Don Lemon & Dr. Frita On Senate Hearing
snippet.description:
A Surgeon General With No Medical License? Tell me how that makes sense. You already know I’m big on training, credentials, and evidence. So watching this Senate hearing was hard.

I had the pleasure of being on the Don Lemon Show today discussing the new Surgeon General nominee.

You can see the full segment @‌thedonlemonshow https://youtu.be/HrgFmx1UPDU

We’re talking about a nominee who didn’t finish residency, isn’t licensed, and couldn’t give a straight answer on encouraging the MMR vaccine during an outbreak where children have died.

When Senator Bill Cassidy, who’s also a physician, asked if she would encourage parents to vaccinate, that was the moment. Informed consent is not new. We do it every day in real exam rooms. But leadership in public health means you stand on the evidence and say it clearly.

If people in low income communities lose trust or access, they’re the ones who pay the price. I break down why this matters more than politics.

Subscribe to my channel. https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCBve_ppCNE67fs3MsIocitg?sub_confirmation=1

Watch the American Heart Health Special Here: https://youtube.com/live/5Z60me8GL-8?feature=share

snippet.title: Peter Parker Flash’ı Rezil Ediyor | Pota Altında Bir Örümcek! 🏀🕷️
snippet.description:
Peter Parker, kazandığı örümcek refleksleri ve gücüyle spor salonuna girdiğinde artık o eski "kolay hedef" değildi. Flash’ın onu küçük düşürme çabalarını boşa çıkaran Peter, topu adeta eline yapıştırarak ve Flash’ın üzerinden uçarak basketbol sahasını bir şov alanına çevirdi. Sahnenin zirve noktası ise Peter’ın o kadar yükseğe zıplayıp potayı kırmasıydı!

Bu sahne, Peter’ın güçlerini kontrol etmeyi henüz tam öğrenemediği ama adaleti kendi yöntemiyle dağıtmaya başladığı o tatlı dönemi temsil ediyor. Flash’ın şaşkın bakışları arasında topu smaçla potadan geçirmesi, izleyen herkese "İşte şimdi işler değişti!" dedirten o anlardan biriydi. Sence Peter, bu güçleri Flash’tan intikam almak için daha fazla kullanmalı mıydı, yoksa potayı kırması yeterli bir ders miydi? 👇

snippet.title: Licensed Operators Get FCC Exemption From New Rules
snippet.description:
The FCC is set to exempt amateur radio operators from new foreign adversary reporting requirements—great news for hams!This YouTube video covers the ARRL's January 15, 2026 update: In a draft Report and Order (GN Docket No. 25-166) released January 8, 2026, and adopted January 29, the FCC places Amateur Radio Service licenses in Schedule C, exempting them from attestation and detailed reporting.Thanks to strong ARRL advocacy, the FCC recognized amateurs pose minimal national security risk—no commercial services, no public network ties, and hobby-only use.

localized.title: Licensed Operators Get FCC Exemption From New Rules
localized.description:
The FCC is set to exempt amateur radio operators from new foreign adversary reporting requirements—great news for hams!This YouTube video covers the ARRL's January 15, 2026 update: In a draft Report and Order (GN Docket No. 25-166) released January 8, 2026, and adopted January 29, the FCC places Amateur Radio Service licenses in Schedule C, exempting them from attestation and detailed reporting.Thanks to strong ARRL advocacy, the FCC recognized amateurs pose minimal national security risk—no commercial services, no public network ties, and hobby-only use. 

Today's video is sponsored by M&P Coax. Save 10% off of all of their products with code HR2CABLES at this link https://geni.us/hr2cables

Portable ham radio always brings adventure… sometimes more than expected!

👉 Get outside. Activate a park. Maybe watch your step.

snippet.title: Parks On The Air (POTA) Activation LIVE-STREAMED 2/28/26 w/ K4AA & KE4EST!
snippet.description:
Licensed Amateur Radio Operators (HAMs) Activating Parks On The Air (POTA)! **This video was live-streamed & uploaded raw & unedited.**

Saturday, February 28nd, 2026.  3'fer at US-4509, US-6927, & US-3791.  We worked two bands (40M & 20M) and made 90 contacts using a Chelegance antenna w/ a Yaesu FT-710.   We worked before and after UTC and accidently ran the truck battery down.  We had to call for help and get a jump start to leave the parks after dark, lol.  And I got aggravated by another station that took over the frequency we were using; I kept repeating, “THE FREQUENCY IS IN USE, the frequency is in use...” lol, over and over again until I finally gave up.  Hehe, always a good time playing radio!

The 3 parks were: 
Nantahala National Forest, US-4509, 
Nantahala State Game Land, US-6927, 
Trail of Tears National Historic Trail, US-3791.

THANK YOU, HUNTERS, FOR THE CONTACTS!  
THANK YOU, VIEWERS, FOR WATCHING! 

Watch more live-streamed Parks On The Air (POTA) Activations w/ K4AA & KE4EST at https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLHCY8H16EyzNk2XfhdgBfy3agCt-nGlWJ

Watch (solo) live-streamed Parks On The Air (POTA) Activations w/ K4AA at https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLHCY8H16EyzPUeN8LB0E2ICngaowmSrWB  
 
K4AA music at https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLHCY8H16EyzMBtYzUDOEg9Wxqm_j9G-y5

THANK YOU VERY MUCH, VIEWERS & HUNTERS!  EACH & EVERYONE OF YOU ARE GREATLY APPRECIATED MORE THAN YOU COULD EVER KNOW!  HAPPY VIEWING & HUNTING!  POTA ON!  73!

Like & Follow...
K4AA on X, https://x.com/AJoyfulHam
K4AA on QRZ, https://qrz.com/db/K4AA
K4AA on IG, https://instagram.com/ajoyfulham
K4AA on YouTube, https://youtube.com/@ajoyfulham

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

Michael (KE4EST) and I (K4AA), are Licensed Amateur Radio Operators (HAMs) enjoying Parks On The Air (POTA) adventures & more!  We often livestream when we Activate the parks.  Watch the POTA spotting page (pota.app) for band and frequency updates.  I also post on IG & X when we go live.  Follow along w/ us as we have fun on the air!  #parksontheair #pota #potalife #hamlife #hamradio #POTAon #SupportYourParks #K4AA #KE4EST #TheFrequencyIsInUse

snippet.title: From Apprentice to 310S Licensed Technician : James’ Journey Through the Trades
snippet.description:
June 24, 2022.

That’s the day James started his journey at Urban Automotive.

Today’s video was filmed on the day he officially passed and became a licensed 310S Automotive Service Technician — and it’s a moment we are incredibly proud of.

In this episode, I sit down with James to talk about what drew him into the trade in the first place, his time at Mohawk College and Conestoga College, and what it really takes to go from apprentice to licensed technician.

He shares the highs, the challenges, and the importance of having the right people around you.

Because no one does this alone.

James speaks about the support he received from:

Mark and Drew as shop mentors

Derek guiding him from the service side

And my role in helping him grow within the business

This video isn’t just a celebration.

It’s proof that the skilled trades are alive, rewarding, and full of opportunity for young people willing to put in the work.

If you’re considering a career in automotive — watch this.

If you’re a parent wondering whether the trades are a smart path — watch this.

If you’re a shop owner investing in apprentices — this is why we do it.

Congratulations, James. You earned this.

🔖 Hashtags

snippet.title: Become a Licensed Nail Tech ✨ | Pro Training & High-End Kit
snippet.description:
💅✨ Inside Our Nail Technician Program – Turn Your Passion Into a Career ✨💅

Thinking about becoming a licensed nail technician? In this video, we’re giving you a look inside our Nail Technician Program at the International Institute of Cosmetology — designed to help you build real skills, real confidence, and a real career in the beauty industry.

Our program goes beyond basic manicures. You’ll get hands-on training in spa treatments, natural and artificial nail systems, sanitation, nail structure, acrylics, gels, and modern techniques that are in demand in today’s salons and spas. 

💎 What makes our program different:
✔️ 100-hour Connecticut-approved program leading to state licensure 
✔️ Hands-on practical training (not just online learning) 
✔️ Learn current nail trends and industry techniques 
✔️ Professional brand partnerships with OPI, Young Nails, PivotPoint and Medicool 

🔥 What you’ll learn:
• Nail anatomy & structure
• Gel and acrylic systems
• Disinfection & sanitation practices
• Natural nail prep & service essentials
• Business basics and professional skills 

Whether your goal is to work in a luxury salon, build your own clientele, or launch your own nail business — this program is built to help you start strong and stand out.

💬 Have questions about becoming a nail tech? Drop them in the comments!
👍 Like, subscribe, and follow for student life, career tips, and real beauty education.

📲 Ready to start your nail journey? Visit us at studyhair.com and connect with admissions to learn more.

#NailTechnician #NailSchool #BeautyCareer #FutureNailArtist #NailTechLife #BeautyEducation #StudyHair

snippet.title: KF8ASE RF Chokes for HAM Radio Get TESTED!
snippet.description:
In this video, we put the KF8ASE RF chokes for HAM radio to the test, comparing their performance and suitability. Whether you're a seasoned HAM radio operator or just starting out, understanding the role of RF chokes in minimizing interference and optimizing your radio's performance is important. We dive into the world of RF chokes, exploring how they work, their importance in HAM radio setups, and what you should look for when selecting the right RF choke for your needs. From amateur radio enthusiasts to professionals, this video aims to provide valuable insights and practical information on RF chokes, helping you make informed decisions to enhance your HAM radio experience. Tune in to find out which RF chokes stand out from the rest and how you can improve your radio's efficiency with the right choke.

Sponsored by http://www.pcbway.com Cheap & quick PCB, 3D Printing, CNC machining, and fabrication services from PCBWay.

Folks, I am not running a NIST certified lab, as a result my results are subject to potential error.  I am an Amateur Radio operator who enjoys testing equipment, your results may vary...
